TEXT: e1: Supermarket employees and people who work in shopping centres also have the right to a Sunday off work.
CN RELATION: people, work in shopping centres (CapableOf)/supermarket employees, right to a Sunday off work (HasA)/people who work in shopping centres, right to a Sunday off work (HasA)/supermarket employees, Sunday off work (Desires)/people who work in shopping centres, Sunday off work (Desires)

TEXT: e2: Likewise public holidays should remain what they are: for some a day of introspection, for others a paid day off that is not taken away from the annual paid leave proper.
CN RELATION: public holidays, remain what they are (CapableOf)/public holidays, day of introspection (IsA)/public holidays, paid day off (IsA)/paid day off, not taken away from the annual paid leave proper (ReceivesAction)/paid day off, not taken away from the annual paid leave proper (DefinedAs)

TEXT: e3: Hence it is good when shops are not open on Sundays and public holidays.
CN RELATION: shops, open on Sundays (NotHasProperty)/shops, open on public holidays (NotHasProperty)/not being open on public holidays, good (HasProperty)/not being open on Sundays, good (HasProperty)

TEXT: e4: People, however, who work during the week and on Saturdays then have a problem: everyone else can shop weekdays, but they can't.
CN RELATION: people, work during the week (CapableOf)/people, work on Saturdays (CapableOf)/people who work during the week, shop weekdays (NotCapableOf)/people who work on Saturdays, shop weekdays (NotCapableOf)/people who work during the week and on Saturdays, shop weekdays (NotCapableOf)/everyone else, shop weekdays (CapableOf)

TEXT: e5: For those people the late opening hours, which meanwhile already extend to 12:00 midnight, present a good alternative.
CN RELATION: late opening hours, extend to 12:00 midnight (CapableOf)/alternative, good (HasProperty)/late opening hours, alternative (IsA)/people who work during the week, alternative (Desires)/people who work on Saturdays, alternative (Desires)

MISSING INFORMATION 1: If shops are not open on Sundays and public holidays, employees and people working in shopping centres have a Sunday off.
CN RELATIONS 1: shops not being open on Sundays, having a Sunday off (Causes)/shops not being open on public holidays, having a Sunday off (Causes)/employees, have a Sunday off (CapableOf)/people working in shopping centres, have a Sunday off (CapableOf)/shops not being open on Sundays, Sunday off (Causes)/shops not being open on public holidays, Sunday off (Causes)/employees, Sunday off (HasA)/people working in shopping centres, Sunday off (HasA)

MISSING INFORMATION 1: One should not have to work on holidays.
MISSING INFORMATION 2: Open shops on holidays means that employees have to work.
CN RELATIONS 2: open shops on holidays, working of employees (HasPrerequisite)/shops, open on holidays (HasProperty)/employees, work on holidays (CapableOf)/employees, shop (AtLocation)/opening shops on holidays, employees have to work (Causes)

MISSING INFORMATION 1: If shops are not open, you cannot go shopping
CN RELATIONS 1: shops, not open (HasProperty)/you, go shopping if shops are not open (NotCapableOf)/no open shops, no shopping (Causes)/shopping, no shops open (ObstructedBy)/going shopping, shops being open (HasPrerequisite)

MISSING INFORMATION 1: Since employees cannot go shopping during the day, they benefit from late opening hours.
CN RELATIONS 1: employees, going shopping during the day (NotCapableOf)/employees, benefit from late opening hours (CapableOf)/not being able to go shopping during the day, shop during late opening hours (CausesDesire)
MISSING INFORMATION 2: If employees can go shopping at late opening hours, shops can remain closed on Sundays and public holidays.
CN RELATIONS 2: employees, go shopping at late opening hours (CapableOf)/shops, closed on Sundays and public holidays (HasProperty)/employees, shops (AtLocation)/shopping at late opening hours, shops opening on Sundays (NotCausesDesire)/shopping at late opening hours, shops opening on public holidays (NotCausesDesire)/shops, remain closed on Sundays (CapableOf)/shops, remain closed on public holidays (CapableOf)

MISSING INFORMATION 2: Sundays are a paid day off.

MISSING INFORMATION 2: People can only shop during the opening hours of shops.
